method.name: POST
method.doc: To test a connection, issue an HTTP POST command on the network URI.

request.doc:
POST https://{appliance_hostname}/net/connect
POST_DATA: { "ssl" : true, "server" : "1.1.1.1", "port" : 443, "showcerts" : true, "status" : true, "key" : "lmi_trust_store:server", "reconnect" : true, "pause" : true, "debug" : true, "msg" : true, "nbio_test" : true, "state" : true, "nbio" : true, "crlf" : true, "quiet" : true, "ssl3" : true, "tls1_2" : true, "tls1_1" : true, "tls1" : true, "dtls1" : true, "no_ssl2" : true, "no_ssl3" : true, "no_tls1_2" : true, "no_tls1_1" : true, "no_tls1" : true, "tlsextdebug" : true, "timeout" : 5 }

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: ContentType:application/json
param.doc: Request is in JSON formatting

param.name: server
param.doc: The server to connect to.

param.name: port
param.doc: The server port to connect to. Must be in the range 1 to 65536.

param.name: ssl
param.doc: Whether to run the test using SSL (true) or TCP (false). The default of true will be used if not specified.

param.name: timeout
param.doc: The time to wait before giving up on a connection (in seconds). The default of 60 will be used if not specified.

param.name: key
param.doc: The keystore and certificate to use on the connection request in the form keystore:label. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: showcerts
param.doc: If true then show the entire certificate chain. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: status
param.doc: If true then send a certificate status request to the server. The server response is included in the output. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: reconnect
param.doc: If true then reconnect to the same server multiple times to ensure that session caching is working. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: pause
param.doc: If true then pause for 1 second between each read and write call. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: debug
param.doc: If true then print more verbose debugging information. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: msg
param.doc: If true then show all protocol messages with hex dump. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: nbio_test
param.doc: If true then test non blocking IO. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: state
param.doc: If true then print the SSL session states. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: nbio
param.doc: If true then turn on non blocking IO. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: crlf
param.doc: If true then translate a line feed into CR+LF. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: quiet
param.doc: If true then inhibit the printing of session and certificate information. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: ssl3
param.doc: If true then attempt to connect using SSL v3. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: tls1_2
param.doc: If true then attempt to connect using TLS v1.2. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: tls1_1
param.doc: If true then attempt to connect using TLS v1.1. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: tls1
param.doc: If true then attempt to connect using TLS v1. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: dtls1
param.doc: If true then attempt to connect using DTLS v1. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: no_ssl2
param.doc: If true then disable use of SSL v2 during connect. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: no_ssl3
param.doc: If true then disable use of SSL v3 during connect. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: no_tls1_2
param.doc: If true then disable use of TLS v1.2 during connect. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: no_tls1_1
param.doc: If true then disable use of TLS v1.1 during connect. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: no_tls1
param.doc: If true then disable use of TLS v1 during connect. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: tlsextdebug
param.doc: If true then print out a hex dump of any TLS extensions received from the server. This parameter is only valid for SSL connections.

param.name: ContentType:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: output
param.doc: The output generated during the connection test (if any)

param.name: ContentType:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting

param.name: output
param.doc: The output generated during the connection test (if any)
